thread.title: Bengals 27, Seahawks 24 (OT): First impressions
thread.title_full: Bengals 27, Seahawks 24 (OT): First impressions | The Seattle Times

author: Seattle Times staff
title: Bengals 27, Seahawks 24 (OT): First impressions
text:
First impressions from the Seahawks’ 27-24 overtime loss to the Bengals on Sunday in Cincinnati:
Larry Stone: Figuring out how the Seahawks went from comfortably ahead 24-7 in the fourth quarter to losing 27-24 in overtime will haunt their dreams this week. The quick answer: All the deficiencies that have plagued them this season, most noticeably a porous offensive line, came back with a vengeance.
SEAHAWKS AT BENGALS » Photo gallery Full coverage Seahawks again fail to hold late lead Web reaction: Fans, media on Seahawks' 'devastating' loss to Bengals Grades: Low marks for Seahawks' late struggles Full game highlights Bengals 27, Seahawks 24: First impressions from Condotta, Jenks, Stone Bobby Wagner recovers fumble for TD Thomas Rawls scores on 69-yard TD run Earl Thomas snags Seattle's 1st pick of season; Michael Bennett negates return Russell Wilson hits Jermaine Kearse for 30-yard touchdown Jon Ryan fires back at Brian Billick's 'kickers aren't football players' comment Matt Calkins: Marshawn Lynch may go from Beast Mode to Decreased Mode Bob Condotta: That game looked over after the Bobby Wagner fumble-recovery touchdown — a few fans in Cincinnati definitely left for good at that point. But Seattle’s suddenly worrisome trend of allowing late leads to slip away developed in a most painful fashion. At 2-3, the Seahawks suddenly are at a crossroads.
Jayson Jenks: The offense has plenty of questions to answer. The defense will take much of the attention from this loss, but the offense shoulders equal responsibility. The Seahawks had plenty of chances to put this game away, and their offense sputtered in the second half.
Seattle Times staff
